cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is said to play a crucial role within the broader domain of nonverbal communication.
remarks: Captures inclusion/functional contribution relation rather than strict taxonomy.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is crucial in social interactions.
Body language is important for interpersonal relationships.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject has an important functional role or influence within the process, domain, or context represented by the object.
args.justification: All three relations describe body language having an important functional role or influence within a broader domain or type of interaction (nonverbal communication, social interactions, relationships). Despite slightly different original relation_names, the core predicate meaning is the same: body language plays a crucial role in these contexts.

Each relation expresses that the subject serves a key functional role or contributes significantly within a broader context (communication domain, social interaction, interpersonal relationships). Grouping them under a functional_role_relation class captures this shared semantics more precisely than generic association.

The relations indicate that body language exerts influence and plays a crucial role in the outcomes or qualities of the target contexts (nonverbal communication effectiveness, social interactions, relationships). This is best modeled as a broad causal/impact dimension rather than simple co-occurrence.
